November 16, 2012

Dear Department Chairs,

You've all been working very hard over the past several months to articulate clear and challenging outcomes.  You've accomplished a great deal and I hope that you recognize that.  Nonetheless, there is still a lot of climbing to do. The road ahead spirals steadily upward.  

The image on the left represents a perpetual improvement process.  As we move from step to step, our capacity to create effective learning experiences grows.  We capture that learning and then raise our expectations as we continue to spiral upward.  The articulation and review of your program outcomes was Step 1.  The question is "What will our students know, be able to do, and become?"    

Step 2 is the design and review of assessments for your outcomes.  The question here is "How will we know what they know, what they are able to do, and what they have become?"  Your assessment plans should describe the instruments you will use to gauge the quantity and quality of learning in your degree programs, what you hope to learn from the results, and how those results will point your program toward improvement.    

To give us time to provide feedback prior to your stewardship reviews, assessment plans are due November 16.  

Please follow these steps to work toward a full assessment plan:  

  1. Identify a critical outcome.  Tackle more if you are ready but it's really okay to start with just one! 
  2. List the instruments you already use or want to use to measure that outcome. 
  3. Finally, answer these questions: (a) What do we believe this assessment is going to tell us? (b) How are we going to use that information to improve our program?   

You can find more information on designing assessments here.

We'll be looking forward to seeing your plans,  

The Outcomes & Assessment Review Committee
